articles.description: Nottingham Forest sack Sean Dyche as head coach after less than four months in charge and are looking for their fourth boss of the season.
articles.title: Sean Dyche sacked by Nottingham Forest with club in relegation fight

articles.description: Pep Guardiola vowed his Manchester City side would "breathe down the neck of Arsenal" as they aim to hunt down the Premier League leaders in this fascinating title race.
articles.title: Man City 3-0 Fulham: Pep Guardiola's side close in on leaders Arsenal

articles.description: Thomas Frank has been sacked as Tottenham manager after just eight months in charge. BBC Sport's Sami Mokbel takes a closer look at his tenure.
articles.title: Thomas Frank: Inside the Tottenham manager's eight-month struggle

articles.description: Lindsey Vonn says she is "making progress" after having a successful third surgery on the broken leg she sustained in a crash at the Winter Olympics on Sunday.
articles.title: Lindsey Vonn: American skier has third surgery after Winter Olympics crash

articles.description: Captain Harry Brook says England's batters were "too careful" in their 30-run defeat by West Indies at the T20 World Cup.
articles.title: T20 World Cup: England batters too 'careful' in defeat by West Indies, says Harry Brook

articles.description: Sir Keir Starmer said comments by the businessman and Manchester United co-owner were "offensive and wrong".
articles.title: PM tells Sir Jim Ratcliffe to apologise for saying UK 'colonised by immigrants'

articles.description: Lilah Fear and Lewis Gibson miss out on becoming the first British figure skaters in 32 years to win an Olympic medal, as they fail to make the ice dance podium.
articles.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: GB's Lilah Fear & Lewis Gibson miss out on figure skating medal

articles.description: Liverpool put in an impressive away performance to become the first team to win at Sunderland in the Premier League this season.
articles.title: Sunderland 0-1 Liverpool: Virgil van Dijk heads winner for visitors

articles.description: Harry Kane continues his scoring streak against RB Leipzig to fire Bayern Munich into the German Cup semi-finals for the first time in six years.
articles.title: Bayern Munich 2-0 RB Leipzig: Harry Kane scores in German Cup

articles.description: The acting head of US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has told a congressional committee that the agency is "a key part of the overall security apparatus for the World Cup" when asked if he would pause operations for this summer's tournament.
articles.title: Fifa World Cup: ICE will be 'key part of security' in US
